et: Latin {it}Rostra{/it}, plural, a platform for speakers in the Roman Forum decorated with the beaks of captured ships, from plural of {it}rostrum{/it}

dt: {bc}an ancient Roman platform for public orators
{bc}the curved end of a ship's prow
{bc}a bodily part or process suggesting a bird's bill: such as
{bc}the beak, snout, or proboscis of any of various insects or arachnids
{bc}the often spinelike anterior median prolongation of the carapace of a crustacean (such as a crayfish or lobster)

et: Latin, beak, ship's beak, from {it}rodere{/it} to gnaw {ma}{mat|rodent|}{/ma}
shortdef: an ancient Roman platform for public orators
a raised platform on a stage
